intro: Tetrapterys acutifolia var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic-leaved acutifoliate, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elliptical leaves that are typically pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of white or pale pink. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
